text: Decaphora is a genus of huntsman spiders that was first described by P. Franganillo B. in 1931. ==Species== it contains five species, found in Central America, Cuba, the Bahamas, Mexico, the United States, and Colombia: *Decaphora cubana (Banks, 1909) (type) – USA, Bahamas, Cuba *Decaphora kohunlich Rheims & Alayón, 2014 – Mexico, Guatemala *Decaphora pestai (Reimoser, 1939) – Belize, Nicaragua, Costa Rica *Decaphora planada Rheims, 2017 – Colombia *Decaphora variabilis (F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1900) – Mexico ==See also== * List of Sparassidae species ==References== Category:Araneomorphae genera Category:Sparassidae Category:Spiders of Central America Category:Spiders of North America
title: Decaphora
